title: feat(sdk): support multiple instances of interactive questions with isolated redux stores
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44670

### Description

Injects an isolated Redux store provider for each interactive questions, using the initial state from the root store. This makes it so that each interactive questions can operate independently, with independent query, filter and error states.

### Why?

The query builder is currently designed to operate on only one query at a time, e.g. one card, one query results, one error pages. With the SDK, we can have many queries at once. 

This is a hacky solution, but it is preferable to refactoring the entire query builder to support multiple instances of queries. I estimate multiple weeks of work if we go with refactoring the QB. I assume that most SDK users in the beginning won't have more than 20 interactive questions in a single page, so the additional Redux store's memory footprint is negligible. In addition, we still rely on a single root store for every static questions and static dashboards.

### How to verify

- Checkout the `test-isolated-redux-store` branch in the Shoppy app. Note that this is based on Vite (https://github.com/metabase/shoppy/pull/44) - please edit your `.env` and replace `REACT_APP` with `VITE_APP`, then run with `yarn dev`
- Navigate to the kitchen sink endpoint `/dev`
- In the `KitchenSink.tsx` page, there should be multiple interactive questions. You can add a couple more questions there.
- Each interactive questions must be able to operate independently.

### Caveat

- The initial state of the isolated store is inherited from the root redux store, therefore it inherits the authentication state (e.g. refresh token, login states) from when useMemo captures the initial state.

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/d8016dda-989a-43e1-91ed-a589d6e1a9c8

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - to fix InteractiveQuestion tests
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: fix(sdk): Upgrade outdated dependencies to remove installation warnings
body:
Closes part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44772

### Description

We want to fix warnings shown during dependencies installation using SDK npm package.

**Before:**
```
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/axis@1.8.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.3.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/grid@1.16.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^15.0.0-0 || ^16.0.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/group@1.7.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^15.0.0-0 || ^16.0.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/text@1.7.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.3.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/axis > @visx/shape@1.8.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.3.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > @visx/grid > @visx/shape@1.16.0" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.3.0-0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > postcss-discard-comments@6.0.2" has unmet peer dependency "postcss@^8.4.31".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > react-motion@0.5.2" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^0.14.9 || ^15.3.0 || ^16.0.0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > react-textarea-autosize@5.2.1" has incorrect peer dependency "react@>=0.14.0 <17.0.0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > react-router@3.2.6" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^0.14.0 || ^15.0.0 || ^16.0.0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > kbar > react-virtual@2.10.4" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.6.3 || ^17.0.0".

```


**After:**
```
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > react-router@3.2.6" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^0.14.0 || ^15.0.0 || ^16.0.0".
warning "@metabase/embedding-sdk-react > kbar > react-virtual@2.10.4" has incorrect peer dependency "react@^16.6.3 || ^17.0.0".
```

### How to verify

Try to install shoppy app with package built from this commit:

- It should have fewer warnings.
- CI should pass.
- No visual regressions should happen.
author: deniskaber

title: Fix FE crash for line/area/bar charts with no data
body:
Fixes #44637

This fixes an issue where rendering a time-series chart with no data would either crash the FE or make it stuck in a loading state. I believe there are two underlying problems (the original issue mentions either an FE error about array `includes` or another error about `clone`):

1. QB has a `getTimeseriesXDomain` selector that returns the min/max date for a time-series. We use that info to filter out suitable timeline events. Apparently, if there's no data, xDomain is `[ undefined, undefined ]`. We've recently added code working with the `xDomain` to fix an issue with timeline events (#44355), and that code started to fail. It made the issue more prominent though, because of the same problem we also had a FE crash when opening the timeline events sidebar in similar scenario
2. As @dpsutton mentioned [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0641E4PB9B/p1719323759632479?thread_ts=1719323278.429529&cid=C0641E4PB9B), there are rare circumstances when a database object coming from the API could lack the `features` property. However, the FE code assumes it's always present, and it failed in a similar situation. It's pretty hard to reproduce and cover with a test, so hopefully, TypeScript should provide enough safety

### To verify

1. New > SQL Query
2. Fill in `SELECT '2023-01-01'::date, 2 FROM PEOPLE WHERE false` and run the query
3. Change the visualization to line/area/bar
4. Make sure it doesn't crash and doesn't get stuck in a loading state, but shows "No results"
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: WIP: Update url when editing question in notebook editor
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38148

### Description

This PR enables the `shouldUpdateUrl` flag in the notebook editor, causing the base64 string in the url to update as a user makes changes to a question in the notebook.

This enables a couple of things:
- refreshing the notebook editor does not lose state, you can keep editing from where you left of 
- you can now share links to unfinished/unsaved questions



### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. create a new question in the notebook editor
2. make some changes (ie. add filters, aggregations, custom columns, ...)
3. refresh the page at every step, the notebook editor should not lose state

### Extra considerations

As it stands, this also works for saved questions. This might be a bit unintuitive:
1. Open a saved question (let's say it's named "Question Foo") in the notebook editor
2. make some changes
4. copy the link in the url bar and share it with a coworker
5. open the shared link in a new browser window/tab
6. the question should be in the same state as at the end of step 2.
7. save the question, you will get asked to override "Question Foo"

Some product input would be nice here.

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/d2d0fccc-9687-408c-90a4-4c5c6e7425a6
author: romeovs
labels: [('.Product Input Needed', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: expose MB_DB_QUERY_TIMEOUT_MINUTES setting
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41685

### Description

I created the MB_DB_QUERY_TIMEOUT_MINUTES setting and used it in the *query-timeout-ms* function.


### How to verify
I used oracle db for tests.
Test query:
```
WITH FUNCTION my_sleep(i NUMBER)
RETURN NUMBER IS
BEGIN
    DBMS_SESSION.sleep(i);
    RETURN i;
END;
SELECT my_sleep(X) FROM dual
```

Custom MB_DB_QUERY_TIMEOUT_MINUTES
1. Set the environment variable MB_DB_QUERY_TIMEOUT_MINUTES=1
2. Run the test query for X=30 in native query mode. The query should return a result.
3. Run the test query for X=130 in native query mode. Metabase should throw an exception.

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix order by field refs
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44653

### Description

Problem _is_ that lib returns integer field ref from `orderable-columns` and string field ref presumably from `breakoutable-columns` if source table references a model.

QP middleware `add-implicit-clauses`, while attempting to add breakout columns to order by, did not recognize those, which reference same column as already referenced by other order by elements. That resulted in a duplicates (or near duplicates, that are also incorrect).

This PR mitigates that by (1) adding a check, if there are any _top level order by elements that are integer field refs_, and that reference same fields as string field references in breakout. (2) If there are, those are swapped for field refs from breakout.

Aside, on 49 integer field ids are used consistently. I recall reading somewhere we should aim for string ids. I was unable to find reasonable way of achieving that in a lib code, hence this fix. The underlying problem, of this and multiple other issues, will be solved by field refs effort that hopefully will take place soon.

### How to verify

Execute reproduction from linked issue. See modified and added tests.

### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: lbrdnk

title: fix(sdk): Convert components in `InteractiveQuestion` to context-aware components
body: Follow up to #44730 - this PR moves elements in `InteractiveQuestionResult` to separate components that can be used within the `InteractiveQuestionContext`. This change decouples the data-loading and display elements so we can add filter, summarize, and notebook components (and future question components) more easily, since the question/query/etc data will be in one place that can be accessed through one common hook.

title: Remove description length check from copy question form
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43983, internal discussion [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1718628995208319)

We don't have a max length check for question descriptions when creating a question, or when editing a description in chill mode's sidebar. However, there's a 255-length limit in the copy question form which is inconsistent and can lead to odd situations like [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44470#issuecomment-2189190995). The PR removes that limit

title: fix(sdk): Move InteractiveQuestionResult variables into provider
body:
This PR is the final "setup" PR for #44494. The goal of the PR is to reduce the amount of duplication and simplify the code for visualizations, filters, and other elements within the `InteractiveQuestion`. 

The idea of this refactor also comes from #44494 - after doing a quick PoC of adding the filter, summarize, and notebook components, I noticed that I was drilling quite a few props to each component and we would be locked into the single layout that we have with `InteractiveQuestionResult` - it would also force us to couple the logic with the layout of the interactive question, which may be an issue in the future if we want to offer some level of customization in how components look and feel within client apps.
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix appends for long column names
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44724

### Description

This adds explicit truncation to the uploaded column names, to fix a spurious mismatch between the existing and appended schema.

This also fixes a few places where we were doing redundant normalization.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2190928767, 'issue_id': 2374451150, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit 9de6e38807ba231493e8701745a41c10eda115d7
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 2 Flaky
‚úÖ 2700 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 26, 6, 40, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2191369887, 'issue_id': 2374451150, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'Testing was a good call, by using H2 I ran into a second issue - the maximum length of `metabase_field.name` values.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 26, 10, 37, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2192717280, 'issue_id': 2374451150, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': 'This fixes the issue for CSV upload tables created after this change lands, but doesn't solve the problem for any upload tables created previously. And if the column name happens to have a name long enough to be truncated by the buffer but not long enough to be truncated by the database, it can actually can _break_ appends/replacements that would have worked before this change. I think we should at least try and fix appends/replacements for any CSV files that were previously uploaded with long names too. Repro steps: 1. Checkout before this change merged to master `git checkout fb4bbfa6e7` 2. Start Metabase, attach a Postgres DB, and enable uploads 3. Upload a CSV with a long name (greater than 63 characters for Postgres) 4. Checkout after this change `git checkout dd7996b756` 5. Try to append to the CSV table created in step 3 with the same file, and note the error. If you remove the ` unique-field-name-buffer` it fixes the issue for a Postgres DB with the default settings. Like this: ```diff diff --git a/src/metabase/upload.clj b/src/metabase/upload.clj index c5e2ba7076..263b23801a 100644 --- a/src/metabase/upload.clj +++ b/src/metabase/upload.clj @@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ (u/slugify (str/trim raw-name) (let [column-limit (some-> driver driver/column-name-length-limit) max-len (min-safe column-limit max-field-name-length)] - {:max-length (- max-len unique-field-name-buffer)})))) + {:max-length max-len})))) (def auto-pk-column-name "The lower-case name of the auto-incrementing PK column. The actual name in the database could be in upper-case." ``` Of course the downside is that we don't have a buffer anymore, but since there's not a clear case for its existence, I think it's better to remove it. And if we really want a buffer in the future we should introduce it in a way that doesn't break existing CSV appends.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 26, 22, 21, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2194057493, 'issue_id': 2374451150, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "Good catch - I tested that use case only before adding the buffer. It should have had a test. Regarding it lacking a use case, the buffer was needed to fix behavior with exactly matching columns in the initial upload. Since we allow duplicate columns the initial upload when they are short, we should also support it when they are long. I agree that gracefully handling existing uploads is more important though. The improvement mentioned in my earlier comment, of replacing the uniquify util to preserve length, will also fix this issue, without the regression on initial uploads, and solving the long matching prefix problem at the same time. Since it's not that complicated, I'd rather roll forward instead of the suggested revert.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 27, 8, 7, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2194297237, 'issue_id': 2374451150, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'We actually did have a test which "should" have caught this issue, but unfortunately since we rely on using an intermediate "start" CSV file to test appending, the issues cancelled out. Perhaps it's worth tweaking these tests so that we can build the initial table directly, which will also be more efficient.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 27, 10, 8, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-06-26 10:37:34 UTC): Testing was a good call, by using H2 I ran into a second issue - the maximum length of `metabase_field.name` values. calherries on (2024-06-26 22:21:44 UTC): This fixes the issue for CSV upload tables created after this change lands, but doesn't solve the problem for any upload tables created previously. And if the column name happens to have a name long enough to be truncated by the buffer but not long enough to be truncated by the database, it can actually can _break_ appends/replacements that would have worked before this change. I think we should at least try and fix appends/replacements for any CSV files that were previously uploaded with long names too. Repro steps: 1. Checkout before this change merged to master `git checkout fb4bbfa6e7` 2. Start Metabase, attach a Postgres DB, and enable uploads 3. Upload a CSV with a long name (greater than 63 characters for Postgres) 4. Checkout after this change `git checkout dd7996b756` 5. Try to append to the CSV table created in step 3 with the same file, and note the error. If you remove the ` unique-field-name-buffer` it fixes the issue for a Postgres DB with the default settings. Like this: ```diff diff --git a/src/metabase/upload.clj b/src/metabase/upload.clj index c5e2ba7076..263b23801a 100644 --- a/src/metabase/upload.clj +++ b/src/metabase/upload.clj @@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ (u/slugify (str/trim raw-name) (let [column-limit (some-> driver driver/column-name-length-limit) max-len (min-safe column-limit max-field-name-length)] - {:max-length (- max-len unique-field-name-buffer)})))) + {:max-length max-len})))) (def auto-pk-column-name "The lower-case name of the auto-incrementing PK column. The actual name in the database could be in upper-case." ``` Of course the downside is that we don't have a buffer anymore, but since there's not a clear case for its existence, I think it's better to remove it. And if we really want a buffer in the future we should introduce it in a way that doesn't break existing CSV appends. crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-06-27 08:07:09 UTC): Good catch - I tested that use case only before adding the buffer. It should have had a test. Regarding it lacking a use case, the buffer was needed to fix behavior with exactly matching columns in the initial upload. Since we allow duplicate columns the initial upload when they are short, we should also support it when they are long. I agree that gracefully handling existing uploads is more important though. The improvement mentioned in my earlier comment, of replacing the uniquify util to preserve length, will also fix this issue, without the regression on initial uploads, and solving the long matching prefix problem at the same time. Since it's not that complicated, I'd rather roll forward instead of the suggested revert. crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-06-27 10:08:20 UTC): We actually did have a test which "should" have caught this issue, but unfortunately since we rely on using an intermediate "start" CSV file to test appending, the issues cancelled out. Perhaps it's worth tweaking these tests so that we can build the initial table directly, which will also be more efficient.

title: Test to prove #28136 is fixed
body:
Fixes #28136

Actually #28136 is already fixed but this test proves it.

Kinda complicated, Redshift has no `pg_sleep()` so I had to `CREATE FUNCTION` one myself. Then I had to write crazy queries because Redshift seems to think those queries return instantly unless I hacked in some DML in there.

How to verify:
- Existing cases should work (CI is green?)
- Models with metadata overwrites with the same DB column should work

title: Memoize driver.u/supports?
body:
This PR adds memoization to `driver.u/supports?` so we can avoid creating many threads if it is called frequently in a tight loop.

It's a speculative fix for some of the performance problems we've been dealing with recently.
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Update default `map.type` display for breakouts with un-binned coordinates
body:
- Closes: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/10734
---
**Demo**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/22608765/b11efbe4-e6ab-4f40-b277-330539c71c98



---
**How to Manually Verify**
1. Open up the query builder
2. Create a query with one aggregation and two unbinned coordinate breakout columns
3. Click visualize and see that the default display is `"map"` with type `"pin"`
4. Create a query with one aggregation and two binned coordinate breakout columns
5. Click visualize and see that the default display is `"map"` with type `"grid"`

---
**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] If a query has two coordinate breakout columns that are not both binned, then use the "pin" map type as the default
- [ ] If a query has two coordinate breakout columns that are both binned, then use the "grid" map type as the default
- [ ] Updated `display.unit.spec.ts` to validate and enforce the default display desired behaviors
- [ ] All other tests continue to pass
author: JesseSDevaney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Add an API to get stale dashboards and cards
body:
This introduces the `metabase.stale` module, which has one public
function (so far): `metabase.stale/find-candidates`. This takes a set of
`collection-ids`, a cutoff date, and pagination/sort info.

Next, we'll write an HTTP API endpoint that will figure out the appropriate
set of `collection-ids` for a given user/request, call this function,
and return the results in the shape we want.
author: johnswanson

title: Fix graph.metrics sync after adding a new query stage
body:
Closes #44668

When a new query stage is added, we lose the `source` info for columns from previous stages, and they're all coming with `source: "fields".` `syncGraphMetricSettings` expect metric columns to always have `source: "aggregation"`, so it drops these columns even when they're available. Fixed by removing the `source` check
author: kulyk

title: Fix changing viz type for nodata users
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37374
Root cause https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/ffbad1d6ae2d56f634102f90a8d77a129765b004/frontend/src/metabase/query_builder/actions/core/updateQuestion.ts#L184 

Changing to and from Pivot breaks for nodata users.

This PR fixes the check in `querying.js` to turn into ad-hoc queries only when the actual query has been changed and not just viz settings. I also tried to fix the appearance of the "Rerun" button but it broke too many tests so I decided to fix the issue with changing viz settings only.

title: Fix cross-version tests
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44661 as a bandaid

the real fix will be https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44662

## Description

These tests broke because people updated them as if they would be run on the branch they are in, like any other test. Since we run these so infrequently, it wasn't obvious when/what/why they broke. What actually broke them was people being good citizens and updating them to support new features (metrics and echarts visualizations), however, the versions we're testing against don't support those new features at all.

Until we move to a branch-based cross-version-testing model, this will run cross version tests nightly, and on any PR that changes code in the cross-version testing directory.
author: iethree
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

title: remove dashboardcontrols from normal dashboard
body:
### Description

This is part of a refactor I'm working on, the first part was done in [refactor DashboardControls (+115 ‚àí49)](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44558).

The end goal was to remove `DashboardControls` because:
- HOCs are deprecated
- they kinda behave as black holes for typescript types
- it was shared between public/static and normal dashboard, but not all the logic in it applied to both

The [first pr](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44558) removed DashboardControls from `PublicOrEmbeddedDashboard` while this pr removes it from the normal dashboard and also delete the HOC completely.

The benefit should be a more clear and easy to understand flow of props (one less HOC to worry about) and have better typescript support.

Regarding typescript, we still have a `@ts-expect-error` because we have a lot of mismatches on the types of the thunks passed as props, I'll see in the next few days if I have time to fix those too


### How to verify

Everything should work as before
author: npretto
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: [cache] surface last run time and make sure "nocache" won't use cache
body:
A little change, first we want to show last execution time of a query to users - and frontend actually uses `updated_at` field, it's just nothing on backend actually returns in. But I re-use `cached` field - it's communicated to the frontend anyways, accounted in tests and makes more sense than `updated_at`.

And `:nocache` obviously should mean 'do not use cache' as much as it means 'do not store cache'.

Fixes #44458, fixes #42778

title: Re-enable flaking metabot test
body:
Refs https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36785

Since the logs for the original flakes have expired, we might as well start by running it once more, until we see it flake again.

The test is still passing locally.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 2189676267, 'issue_id': 2372124473, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': "I don't think it's worth bringing back the test flakes to fix it, since the code under test is dead and has been for over a year we should explore deleting the code instead.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 25, 18, 21, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2189694794, 'issue_id': 2372124473, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': "Sorry, I'm mistaken! The code is not actually dead since metabot can be enabled with an experimental feature flag: `MB_IS_METABOT_ENABLED` via env vars. Even so, I'm skeptical we have any benefits from re-enabling this test until we start working on it again. The env var is not documented, but Luiggi [shared the env var on the discussion forum](https://discourse.metabase.com/t/is-there-a-way-to-use-metabase-with-chatgpt/26257/4) stating the feature is in alpha.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 25, 18, 31, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2190913156, 'issue_id': 2372124473, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'My only concern with just leaving it, is that after development resumes we fail to notice the disabled assertion, and have a regression. A fringe within a fringe within a fringe. Happy to close.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 26, 6, 34, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
calherries on (2024-06-25 18:21:51 UTC): I don't think it's worth bringing back the test flakes to fix it, since the code under test is dead and has been for over a year we should explore deleting the code instead.

calherries on (2024-06-25 18:31:05 UTC): Sorry, I'm mistaken! The code is not actually dead since metabot can be enabled with an experimental feature flag: `MB_IS_METABOT_ENABLED` via env vars. Even so, I'm skeptical we have any benefits from re-enabling this test until we start working on it again. The env var is not documented, but Luiggi [shared the env var on the discussion forum](https://discourse.metabase.com/t/is-there-a-way-to-use-metabase-with-chatgpt/26257/4) stating the feature is in alpha.

crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-06-26 06:34:48 UTC): My only concern with just leaving it, is that after development resumes we fail to notice the disabled assertion, and have a regression. A fringe within a fringe within a fringe. Happy to close.

title: Fix flaky test:  update-db-to-never-scan-values-on-demand-test
body:
The failure

```
  update db setting to never scan should remove scan field values trigger sanity check that it has all triggers to begin with
expected: #{"metabase.task.sync-and-analyze.trigger.157"
            "metabase.task.update-field-values.trigger.157"}
  actual: #{}  
```
this indicates that the scheduler doesn't have any triggers, and I suspect it's because the scheduler was shut down.
And the reason is that we were using `with-redefs` to bind `quartz-scheduler` during test, and there might be parallel tests that's using the scheduler to and it's shutdown the scheduler after it's done.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44148
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Use default secret key for encrypted settings in dev and test mode
body:
WIP: tests need fixing

This PR changes the value of `default-secret-key` from `nil` to the hash of `"DEFAULT_SECRET_KEY"` in the case that Metabase is running in dev or test mode.

title: Skip syncing field values for oracle CLOB columns
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44109

Getting field values for tables with Oracle CLOB columns never worked. This PR skips getting field values for the CLOB column so we don't waste time doing so, and we stop creating error messages that take up space in the logs.

It also includes a refactoring of `metabase.types`, which adds `:type/fingerprint-unsupported` and `:type/Large` as new "Modifier types". See https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44654/files#diff-f2959272d8c40a4a2f1c9d6fafce63de8089b8ac88cdf8e9d3dc90ad7fdfcc80.

title: Allow clicking "Remove all" for the first group in `FieldPanel` and omit removing the first field in the group
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39912 Previously it wasn't possible to click "Remove all" for the first group in the `FieldPanel`. Now we allow that but leave the first selected field untouched. This matches the notebook behavior. How to verify: - New -> Question -> Products - Visualize - Viz settings -> Add or remove columns - Try `Add all` / `Remove all` - Try adding custom expressions (which cannot be removed), aggregations, breakouts and see what happens - Note that when there are expressions we now disallow deselecting the first field which is not the case in `master`. This is to prevent from construction of subsequently broken queries in the notebook editor which requires 1 field to be selected.

title: Clean up dashboard URL management
body:
Closes #34447, closes #44106, closes #43145

The PR reworks the way we manage dashboard URL query parameters to make it more predictable and reliable.
Not backporting as it seems quite risky, especially since it affects all kinds of dashboards (regular, public, embedded, x-rays)

### Problem overview

Overall, there are three key things we keep in the URL state (including hash) for dashboards:
- parameter values, example: `?category=Gadget&rating=4`
- current tab, example: `?tab=4-overview`
- sharable state: auto-refresh rate, theme, etc. Example: `#refresh=60`

We're syncing URL parameters and dashboard filter values inside the [`useSyncedQueryString` hook](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/97cfe29e894d63733ce29e391d5ff8d5e98fe4d2/frontend/src/metabase/hooks/use-synced-query-string.ts#L6) used by the [`SyncedParametersList` component](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/97cfe29e894d63733ce29e391d5ff8d5e98fe4d2/frontend/src/metabase/parameters/components/ParametersList/SyncedParametersList.tsx#L9). It's important to know that it uses `window.location` to read/update location state. OTOH, dashboard tab URL parameter is managed with `react-router` in the [`useSyncURLSlug` hook](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/97cfe29e894d63733ce29e391d5ff8d5e98fe4d2/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/components/DashboardTabs/use-sync-url-slug.ts#L54).

They're often trying to update the URL concurrently, and since they use different kinds of location states, they're usually out of sync and can overwrite one another in random order. That alone causes issues and makes it hard to reason about URL updates.

On top of that, when we open a dashboard with a `tab` query parameter (like `/dashboard/1?tab=2-overview`), there's a period of time when the [`getSelectedTabId` selector](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/35c84771208aea7b67eabedf5d22786210f6dcc7/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/selectors.ts#L487) returns `null` while dashboard is being loaded. That might confuse both hooks, and it's one of the reasons why #34447 is happening.

### Solution

1. `useSyncedQueryString` and `useSyncURLSlug` are removed in favor of a single `useDashboardUrlQuery` hook to avoid out-of-sync state and concurrent updates
2. More strict checks for when query parameters have to be updated (e.g., we won't try to update the URL if parameters order changes)
3. `getSelectedTabId` is updated to use the `tab` URL parameter from `window.location` while dashboard is being loaded
author: kulyk
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: move subtext to command palette item generation. Support model-indexes
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44136

### Description
Adds subtext to search results in the command palette that are indexed entities. Also re-arranges some logic into util files for (hopefully) easier testing

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1.  Ensure that you have an indexed model (see issue for steps)
2. Type a search query
3. You should see subtext of `a model in ${x}`

### Demo
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/ec5f6717-d72b-4f47-9a34-f39ea70f5758)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: refactor(sdk): Make sense of dashboard and embed code
body:
When I was working on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44488. I came across some parts that looked confusing. So I tried to make the code more consistent and less confusing. And as a refactoring, it shouldn't belong in a feature branch to prevent future conflicts.

Note to reviewers: I didn't wait for the tests to pass. I assume they might pass, if so it's safe to merge this PR, if not, I'll revisit this PR and see if it makes sense to fix tests or just scrap this PR. I fairly confident that the change from this PR would not alter any behaviors.

title: Reconcile Milestones with Release Branch before release
body:
> [!important]
> automation token needs manage project scope added

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44037

### Description

![Screen Shot 2024-07-10 at 8 17 23 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/5772e7fd-a1e7-4ad5-9adf-ba506bd05445)


- checks every commit in the release to make sure it corresponds to an issue in the milestone or conforms to an exception:
  - issues with an earlier milestone already set (e.g. also backported to another release branch)
  - issues with excluded labels for CI, Tests, and Documentation
- any problems are added to a [project](https://github.com/orgs/metabase/projects/93/views/1) and the link to the project is posted in the releases channel 
- posts a link in the slack release thread, and uploads a log of all its decisions

### Todo:
- [x] parse tag history for last release tag in branch
- [x] add github action
- [x] trigger github action from build job
- [x] add slack message

title: Add a reproduction for "Can't edit joined tables after saving the question"
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43531: "Can't edit joined tables after saving the question"

Adds a reproduction for the issue that has been fixed in v50.


Here is the issue description as per the issue:


1. Create a new question
2. Add a few joins
3. Save the question
4. Try editing the question changing one of the joins you made. You'll be able to change the left and right column, but you won't be able to change the left and right tables.
author: romeovs
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: [Mongo] Convert bson Decimal128 negative zero to BigInteger zero
body:
Closes #44506

### Description

~~This PR _has a potential_ to fix the issue. It is not clear from the issue, if results returned from Mongo contain negative zero. Though it seems very likely as the exception mentioned in the issue is almost certainly thrown during the `.bigDecimalValue` conversion of `from-document`.~~

~~I've considered also possibility of digits getting lost _somewhere_ on the application side. I find that unlikely as all `from-document` calls occur right on the results returned from dbms.~~

This PR adds negative zero handling to `from-document` conversion function.

### How to verify

Run the newly added test.

### Checklist

title: Opt out of non-reserved SQL keywords
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44200
Blocked on https://github.com/metabase/macaw/pull/74

### Description

The largest known cause of parsing queries at the moment is due to mistaking "FINAL" for a reserved keyword. This change prevents our SQL parsing failing when this identifier is used for databases that do not reserve it.

title: fix: pivot table disappear
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43129

### Description

**Problem:**
`react-virtualized` [AutoSizer](https://github.com/bvaughn/react-virtualized/blob/e78651c3d844c6f639347d1fb796072783c175d2/source/AutoSizer/AutoSizer.js#L170) depends on `parentNode`'s size after mounted in order to calculate the correct `width` and `height` but [ExplicitSize](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/bdf67dbe3f50af70e8aa64dd5b6bec4685dae573/frontend/src/metabase/components/ExplicitSize.tsx#L213) that wraps `DebouncedFrame` initially pass `null` and them real values. In the end when `AutoSizer` is mounted, its parent (DebouncedFrame) does not have a `height` set resulting in table rows being hidden in a tiny container.

I didn't investigate further why it works when you just arrived at the page because I have the following questions about `DebouncedFrame` and `ExplicitSize`

**Why DebouncedFrame and ExplicitSize?**
From the component comments:
> This component prevents children elements from being rerendered while it's being resized...

I understand the idea here, especially when using together with `ExplicitSize` that it modifies its state whenever you resize the browser window that results in re-render.

I didn't understand the reason why we need to keep track of the component size in a React state and not let the DOM do its job, because doing this, we end up triggering re-render every time the window is resized and also re-rendering the same component twice on mount (first render, set state with actual size, render again).

**Solution**
Remove `DebouncedFrame`
By removing it we also lose the greyed out table while resizing, maybe it's important to keep it ü§î 

I'm opening this a draft pull requests because I'd like to hear feedbacks about this approach.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Create a new question
2. Choose pivot table visualization
3. Open notebook
4. Go back to visualization

### Demo

https://www.loom.com/share/2ef979d755e744da826c25d12b36d992?sid=a91217bc-bf42-4ee1-a12d-c9993b6d0292

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: elton-okawa
labels: [('External', 'PR from an external contributor.')]

title: Fix/logs keep pooling after unmount
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43010

### Description

`useMount` does not offer a cleanup function the same way as `useEffect`, but `useLifecycles` does

- [useMount](https://github.com/streamich/react-use/blob/ade8d3905f544305515d010737b4ae604cc51024/docs/useMount.md)
- [useLifecycles](https://github.com/streamich/react-use/blob/ade8d3905f544305515d010737b4ae604cc51024/docs/useLifecycles.md)

### How to verify

1. Go to go `Admin -> Troubleshooting -> Logs`
2. Leave `Logs` tab - navigate anywhere
3. See in network tab, log polling stopped

### Demo

https://www.loom.com/share/35caa19c8944424a8bca3dadc78c588c?sid=e83bdb98-073e-41bb-8075-8f8bd13ede85

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

labels: [('External', 'PR from an external contributor.')]

title: Fix new column shortcuts overwriting viz settings
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43294
Root cause - in "raw data" mode the display type and viz settings are overwritten https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/1b78f5a361e807dea892ed985add6a5d05d85ccb/frontend/src/metabase/query_builder/selectors.js#L693 so we need to use `useQuestion` selector to get the correct question instance.

How to verify:
- New -> Question -> Orders
- Aggregation -> Count, Breakout -> Created At
- Visualize as a line chart
- Go to raw data -> Click on "+" -> add expressions using new shortcuts
- Go back to viz mode -> your settings shouldn't be overwritten

title: Add `supports-base-type-exactly?` multimethod for tests
body:
This PR adds a multimethod `supports-base-type-exactly?` which will return true for a base-type if it is possible for fields in a test dataset to have columns with that base-type. 

It can be used in driver tests to conditionally test behaviour depending on whether that base-type can be created.

The PR also adds a new test to demonstrate its utility: `metabase.query-processor-test.timezones-test/sql-datetime-timezone-handling-test`
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Wrap non-latin characters in a span specifying working font
body: Fixes: #38753 Please keep in mind that this bug will only show up in rendered table cards, on Slack. All other static-viz chart types render as SVGs via Batik. CSSBox seems to have a bug where font fallback doesn't work properly. This is noticeable when a font does not contain glyphs that are present in the string being rendered. For example, Lato does not have international characters (Cyrillic, Hangul, etc.), so the rendered version of tables (that show up in Slack messages) will not render properly, making the card unreadable. Since this appears to be a downstream bug, I've opted to work around this limitation by wrapping strings containing non-lato characters in a `` that specifies the font family to be sans-serif, which should properly fall back to a font that contains the glyphs and thus render legibly. This is done with a postwalk over the Hiccup data structure, and only attempts to wrap strings inside `#{:div :span :td :th :tr :table :p :tbody :thead}`. If a string contains any glyphs not present in the Lato font, the entire string is wrapped. This is to keep mixed strings (Latin + non-latin chars/glyphs) visibly cohesive. ### Why doesn't the fallback work as we would expect, can't we configure things to work properly? We load the Lato font directly into our GraphicsEnvironment using `java.awt.Font/createFont` https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/88a31b41217f14b6ead98829c53cd5068b5a4ba8/src/metabase/pulse/render/style.clj#L102 We do that because it's used in the SVG rendering to give charts the proper font+style. If we do not load the font in, our SVG charts render slightly incorrectly (font weight is not correct, for example). When you create a font in this way, it is a 'physical font', and will not fallback to another font when glyphs don't exist. Logical fonts DO, but we cannot create logical fonts, they are defined by the JRE. We can derive new fonts from logical fonts, but that copies *attributes* such as size and weight but not glyphs. It *is* possible to have fonts fall back appropriately if you rely on the system's font setup. That is, if you do NOT register Lato, and you DO have lato installed on your machine (at least for me it worked on MacOS), then fallbacks seem to work. I did not go with this approach because I want static-viz renders to still work 'out of the box', so a user shouldn't have to install Lato to get proper renders. For now, I figured it's worth trying this solution over using Noto for 2 reasons: - we can keep Lato, which has been the decided font style for the app for some time (this keeps things consistent where possible) - the Noto font containing all glyphs is quite a large font (>20mb, I think) and it would be nice to avoid bundling that if we can. The fallback clearly isn't working in the first render, which is what the render will look like without this change. And The bottom render is after this wrapping was added:
author: adam-james-v
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Require preConditions for certain liquibase change types to encourage idempotence
body:
This updates the migration linter to require preconditions on create/drop operations (on tables, columns, indexes, and FKs). The idea is that it's usually a good idea to make a migration idempotent‚Äîi.e. check that the index actually exists before you try to drop it, and vice versa. It usually won't make a difference, but it help avoid errors where an instance gets into an inconsistent state and tries to run a migration again for some reason.

You can still skip adding a precondition by including the key (`preConditions:`) but leaving it blank, similar to with rollbacks. But it's a forcing function to consider whether it'd be necessary or useful.

Thought of this as a follow-up for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44455. Adding a precondition to the changeset in question to make it idempotent would have been a better option to support downgrades than an explict rollback migration.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Restore foreign key support for Mongo
body:
Closes #44511

### Description

Probably as part of `driver/supports?` refactor, Mongo foreign key support was removed, instead of transformation to `driver/database-supports?`. Back then support for foreign keys was disabled during testing, hence no tests for eg. implicit joins ran.

This PR restores previous state, apart from conversion to `database-supports?`. Implicit joins were tested manually. Aim of this PR is to return driver to pre-regression state. Automated testing should be carried out as follow up, as required change is non-trivial.

Specifically, my belief is that implicit joins should be decoupled from `:foreign-keys` database feature, because foreign key relationships can be defined in Metabase independently from underlying database support (reproduction from the issue as an example).

If implicit joins are enabled should rather depend on `:joins` database feature. Application should not care if `fk_target_field_id` of `metabase_field` was obtained by sync or was defined by user.

Then, for implicit joins tests to pass, for databases that do not support foreign keys relationships, hence auto detection during sync is not available, `get-or-create-database` post sync hook can be created and relationships could be added to application database based on clojure side examination of test data table definitions.

Stub of described approach can be found in [`tx-post-sync-hook`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/tree/tx-post-sync-hook) branch. Reason, this PR does not contained proposed change is that some tests fail due to ordering differences. My suspicion is that there is another issue with ordering, that is out of scope of pre-regression state restoration.

Finally, the issue https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44573 was opened to track automated testing for Mongo implicit joins.

### How to verify

Manually, until the issue is not addressed.

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('Database/Mongo', None), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: [MBQL lib] Map dashboard filters to last stage w/aggregations
body:
Originally we used the last stage's columns for dashboard filters, but
then if you eg. use a custom expression to clean up the results of the
aggregation, then you can't filter at the most useful spot - before the
aggregations.

Fixes #19744. Related to #26244, #33958.

title: Ft/fix-copy-to-workspace
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]

title: Fix setting the temporal bucket of columns in a join condition to "Don't bin"
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42681
Demo https://www.loom.com/share/b458f7404c6b43dda475f7688103c3bb

Previously, it wasn't impossible to remove bucketing unless you created a join condition without bucketing in the first place. Now we tweak existing logic to make it possible. There are 2 interesting cases:
1. Creating new join condition. Currently the first non-empty temporal bucket wins over others, and we preserve this behavior without changes.
2. Modifying an existing join condition. Currently the temporal bucket of the changed column takes priority, but we fall back to the temporal bucket of the second column if it's empty. We stop doing this now and simply overwrite the bucket for both columns with the last selected temporal bucket in all cases.

How to verify:
- New -> Question -> Orders
- Join Reviews
- LHS column -> Created At by month
- RHS column -> Created At by month
- Select either LHS or RHS column and change the bucketing to "Don't bin"
- Make sure it's respected.

title: fix(sdk): upgrade D3.js to the latest version for Vite compatibility
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44392

### Description

Upgrades the D3.js libraries and its usages to the latest version. See [the issue](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44392) and [the RFC](https://www.notion.so/metabase/106-Upgrade-D3-js-version-to-unblock-Vite-compatibility-for-embedding-SDK-9698ae61ee394446898c6c059d9c530b?pvs=4) for more information.

- Changes the method namespaces to the new flattened version (e.g. `scale.linear` to `scaleLinear`)
- Removed `d3-shape` from dependencies and replaced it with `d3` as it causes unit tests on pie charts to fail, likely due to conflicts
- Uses `scaleLinear(domain, range)` for type inference instead of `scaleLinear().domain(domain).range(range)`
- Replace the removed `d3.round` with a custom `roundFloat`
- Fix TypeScript type changes (e.g. for D3 Arc)

### How to verify

Re-test the affected viz and code paths that are using D3.js:

- Pie Chart
- Row Chart
- Heat Map, Choropleth Map
- Gauge
- Cartesian Chart
- Formatting: Geography, Numbers

### Demo

![CleanShot 2567-06-22 at 01 38 19@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/4e97f016-eb4c-4f8a-8703-04550bf56004)

![CleanShot 2567-06-25 at 01 08 10@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/749afd2a-636a-4520-aca2-164f2c5f8f8c)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Disable Pivot Export Post Processing Step
body:
This PR disables the 'make exports look pivoted' post processing step for csv and xlsx exports.

This is in response to a reported issue that Large Pivot Table downloads are failing entirely: #44556

A more hollistic fix and improvement to the post processing feature will be worked on, so the post processing code is left untouched in this PR.

The dynamic vars in the csv and xlsx namespaces each default `false` and disable the export from running any post processing. The var should remain `false` until we've got a plan for these types of exports, and there is no way for users (either through ENV or UI) to change this, so the feature is effectively disabled.
author: adam-james-v

title: refactor DashboardControls
body:
### Description

This is the first step to remove `DashboardControls` (and other HOC) in favor of hooks and more explicit code.

HOCs are a bit confusing (especially wrt types) and we currently use `DashboardControls` in many places, I think we are putting too much code inside of it and we don't always need it.

## Changes

- Introduces `PublicOrCustomEmbedDashboardPage`
	-  this act as a "Page/Controller/IDontLikeNamingStuff", I moved the hooks calls from DashboardControls to this page so that we can have more control over them and have better type checking
- creates `usePublicDashboardEndpoints` to eventually replace `WithPublicDashboardEndpoints`
- removes public routes from the main router (we don't need them after the fix for metabase#38640)
- removes PublicOrEmbeddedDashboardControlled which was mostly HOCs üöÄ 
- fixes an issue with titles not being set with d032b5f4b2ccaeed45cc03c8e861e42a7f289d59

If you like the approach I used here, I'll continue with also the question and the normal dashboard and eventually remove DashboardControls

title: Fix setting the join strategy for not yet existing join clauses
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42858

Previously we ignored the initial join strategy set before creating a new join clause. This PR fixes the issue by:
1) allowing to pass the join strategy directly when creating a new join clause
2) making the join strategy required on the FE to make sure it's not forgotten - improving the API

How to verify:
- New -> Question -> Orders
- Join Reviews
- Without selecting columns for the join condition, change the join strategy to "Right join"
- Set the columns
- Make sure the join strategy is not ignored

title: refactor: Create static embed view components
body:
This is required for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44488.

This PR creates 2 new view components that receive props from their respective controller components. The change should be fairly straightforward by extracting part of the controllers into new components. There should be no logic change whatsoever.

The reason this code is introduced here is to reduce the amount of conflicts there will be since this involves changes in a file with high traffic. 

To ensure this component works as expected. Please observe both
- static dashboard embed
- static question embed

That the file initiates all data requests to be from the controller not the view component. This way we can later on render these view components in storybook without having to fetch any data, and the result can either be passed down as props, or mocks in Redux store (dashboad and embed get data differently)
![Screenshot 2024-06-21 at 11 22 25‚ÄØPM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/2161c8f6-9eef-403f-ba4a-b91d12f0a074)

In the example above, we can see all data requests (except `api/session/properties` since we don't need that for storybook) are initiated from the controller component.

title: Visually improve time-series chrome component
body:
### Description

This PR changes how the TimeSeriesChrome component look and feel like in subtle, yet impactful ways.
1. It stacks the operator picker on top of the actual filter pickers
2. It reuses the same CurrentDate picker logic that we're using in other date pickers in the app

The component was very wide in the past for the Interval date pickers, such as "Previous" or "Next" because the operator picker was rendered in a row next to the actual filter picker.

This PR completes the Milestone 3 of #44096, and it resolves #44096.

### How to verify
Tests already exist for all these interactions so they should pass in CI.

If you want to manually play with this, follow these steps:
1. Open Orders table and summarize it by Count, broken down by Created At: month
2. Time-series chrome component should be visible in the lower part of the screen

From here you can choose either
- "Previous" or "Next", or
- Current

title: xray should not fail on models with filters
body:
The issue: when we have a Model that has a filter *and* an aggregation, model does not contain filtered field in the end results. Our logic re-applies filters (I guess for the sake of filter tables) on x-ray cards, and this fails since you cannot filter by `created_at` if the data you have is just `id` and `count` columns.

This change skips filters for models, data is already filtered in there.

Fixes #44379
author: piranha
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix dev `migrate!` command
body:
There were two problems here:

- wrong args to `mdb/migrate!` (passing the db-type as well as the data source), and

- in MySQL, the changelog table name is not `:databasechangelog`. Use `metabase.db.liquibase/changelog-table-name` to get the actual table name.

title: Revert graph settings sync change
body:
Fixes #44532, reverts #44053, reopens #10493

> [!NOTE]
> The PR label says "no-backport", but I already opened a manual backport here: #44536
> This PR is adding a repro test to a file that doesn't exist on the `release-x.50.x` branch, so I went ahead with a manual backport

A new graph settings sync step added in #44053 caused a bug when breakouts added to a query sequentially weren't properly picked up by the chart (the first breakout would set the `graph.dimensions` and it won't get updated with next breakouts). The PR reverts the change for now, so we can come up with a more robust fix

### To verify

1. New > Question > Tables > Sample Database > Products > Visualize
2. Click "Summarize" in the top right
3. Hover the "Category" column and click the "+" button
4. Hover the "Created At" column and click the "+" button
5. Ensure you see a correct Count by Category/CreatedAt chart
author: kulyk
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Split `FilterModal` components into separate files and folders
body:
Splits the components within `FilterModal` into separate files and folders. I did this to help prepare the filter components for the SDK, where we will not want the modal but the content inside it. 

This is being done as the first step of separating the filter logic/content from the actual modal itself. There will be a follow-up PR that will use the content in an SDK-specific context.

Absolutely zero refactoring of the logic was done here. I only moved files around, added folders and `index.ts` files, and simplified imports. The tests should pass as normal.
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Implement new `EntityObjectLoaderRtkQuery` that uses RTK Query hooks
body:
Closes #44491

Part of #50317

### Description

Adds `EntityObjectLoaderRtkQuery` which is a replacement for `EntityObjectLoader`.
See [[Tech] Migrate entity framework loaders to RTK Query](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Tech-Migrate-entity-framework-loaders-to-RTK-Query-14369354c90180ecadc2d1f1a5dba6e0) for details.
Enables the new component for 2 types of entities: databases & tables.
Other entities will be ported in separate PRs, and then the old `EntityObjectLoader` will be removed.

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Update browserslist db
body:
This PR is a result of running `npx update-browserslist-db@latest`

[frontend]   npx update-browserslist-db@latest
[frontend]   Why you should do it regularly: https://github.com/browserslist/update-db#readme

title: Don't run sandboxing rollback test on mysql
body:
The test I added in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44481 seems to now be failing on MySQL 8.0 after merging, even though it passed CI on the PR.

It's a rollback test and I think there's been issues with migration rollback tests failing on MySQL in the past. I don't know the root cause but this PR changes it to only run on postgres/h2. I think this is an OK stopgap to get master green since the test isn't mysql-specific.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix pivot table horizontal scrollbar not appearing
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43215 Previously the horizontal scroll bar in the pivot table body was not always visible when it should have been. The root cause was that the `height` parameter from `react-virtualized`'s `AutoSize` component was providing an incorrect value on the initial page render. It was too large, because it was including the height of the query builder footer area below, so the grid ends up filling that height, and the scrollbar is rendered beneath the footer. To fix this, we use the `height` prop provided from the `Visualization` component instead, as it provides a more accurate value. Note that we only use this prop in the query builder, because unfortunately it is incorrect for dashcards since it includes the title as well. I tried to fix the `height` prop measurement by providing the right class name for the selector of the `ExplicitSize` component in `Visualization`, but it caused further issues with the height prop decreasing very slowly (our measurements are slow), which caused the scrollbar to remain offscreen for a long time after narrowing the window. ### How to verify Create the following question and add it to a dashboard. Confirm the scroll bar is visible in both the query builder and in a dashcard, both on initial load and after resizing the window. https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/ee76fba1-c2b5-4b8e-a9bf-c14cf6a81646 Note that on dashboards the scrollbar may be hidden after resizing the dashcard. This is an existing bug, separate from the P1 issue that this PR aims to fix, so we can fix it later.
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Make the App DB transaction isolation level READ_COMMITTED for MySQL [MEGA PERFORMANCE BOOST]
body:
On Postgres the default isolation level is `READ_COMMITTED` while it's a higher level (`REPEATABLE_READ`) for MySQL/MariaDB.

repeatable-read is more than we need or want and involves [a lot of locking](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/innodb-transaction-isolation-levels.html) and we should change it so MySQL/MariaDB uses read-committed like Postgres does and that should speed up app DB access a lot.

I did this in the unpooled DataSource so we only get the overhead of `SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION ...` when we check out new connections. Pooled ones should already be set to the correct level.

THIS IS FOR THE APP DB AND NOT DATA WAREHOUSES!!!!!
author: camsaul
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Fix the order we attempt to set DW transaction isolation in [PERFORMANCE BOOST]
body:
So we're supposed to be setting transaction isolation to the lowest level the DW supports but I'm an idiot and put the list of levels to try in the wrong order, meaning if `READ_UNCOMMITED` isn't supported then we tried `REPEATABLE_READ` next instead of `READ_COMMITED`. Oops! 

This change should speed up queries a lot for DBs that support `READ_COMMITED` but not `READ_UNCOMMITED`.
author: camsaul
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: feat(sdk): Add filter, summarize, and notebook functionality to `InteractiveQuestion`
body:
This PR adds the filter, summarize, and notebook buttons and panes to the `InteractiveQuestionResult` component. 

**Filters**
* `Filter` - the filter pane from `FilterContent`
* `FilterButton` - opens and closes the pane

Calls `onQueryChange` when `Apply filters` is clicked.

**Summarize**
* `Summarize` - the summarize pane from `SummarizeContent`
* `SummarizeButton` - opens and closes the pane

Calls `onQueryChange` when any aggregation is clicked. 

**Notebook**
* `Notebook` - the notebook component of `Notebook` from `"metabase/query_builder/components/notebook/Notebook"`
* `NotebookButton` - opens and closes `Notebook`

Dispatches `dispatch(updateQuestion(question))` when the question is updated. This is called because the Notebook calls `updateQuestion` (which takes in a question rather than a query) so this is a bit of an exception. Since the data is pulled from the store, loading/error/success states are still accounted for in `useInteractiveQuestionData`
author: oisincoveney

title: fix: dont always optimize between expressions
body:
Fixes #42291

The frontend produces expressions like

```
[:between
 [+ [:field ... {:temporal-bucket :day] [:interval 2 :day]]
 [:relative-datetime -1 :week]
 [:relative-datetime 0 :week]]
```

This should not be optimized because of the mixed `:day` and `:week` units. However, it was being optimized since the compatible units weren't being properly picked up by the match.
author: snoe
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Fix #43873 flaky E2E segments test
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?
It fixes E2E flake in data model > segments.
Resolves #43873

### Explanation
When we load a segment based on an Orders table, we have to wait for the metadata for three tables (Orders, and two FK relationships: Products and Users). In the flaky scenario, UI already loads while the metadata itself didn't load. So when we start a new question, it doesn't open an Orders table. It starts from an empty new question picker
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/776fd95d-a814-45b4-8c95-2d8a888b9b06)

### Solution
Explicitly wait for the metadata to load.

### Stress-test
20/20 ‚úÖ https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9599000245
author: nemanjaglumac

title: Fix rollback when sandboxing is configured
body:
In 50, I added a migration to drop the `fk_sandboxes_ref_permissions` FK constraint on the `sandboxes` table. This FK linked sandboxes to their corresponding row in the `permissions` table via the `permission_id` field. As we were moving permission definitions to a new `data_permissions` table, this FK had to be dropped first.

The intent was to eventually drop this `permission_id` column as a cleanup step as it isn't being used. I didn't realize at the time that rollback would break without this cleanup. The reason is, re-adding the FK is only possible if all of the values in the `permission_id` column exist in the `permissions` table or are `NULL`. But without further cleanup, `permission_id` would contain references to rows in `permissions` which had been deleted.

(In retrospect, the migration to drop the FK should not have needed a rollback in the first place. But I think the best way to fix this now is with a new migration that enables the rollback to work without error.)

Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44455
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix(sdk): missing css variables when rendering under a portal
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44391

### Description

When SDK users are rendering the embedding SDK components (such as an interactive question) under a React portal (such as in a modal using their library of choice), the filter colors from the theme settings are not applied. In the screenshot below, you can notice that the filter color is not applied properly in (1).

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/ebb7e685-5434-4186-ae1f-35912115be3c)

This PR separates the components for injecting CSS variables to a public component (i.e. `PublicComponentStylesWrapper`) from the components injecting global sdk styles such as font-face declarations (i.e. `SdkGlobalStylesWrapper`), so we can provide the CSS variables in context of React portals.

### How to verify

- Go to the `fix-react-portal` branch under the Shoppy demo app
- Click on a product card, then click on the topmost chart
- The color should be correct

### Demo

![CleanShot 2567-06-20 at 21 12 11@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/edfc7aee-bde4-4d71-9a35-3bd053c56b9f)

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - to add visual test or unit test next

body:

## How to test
Everything should be working outside of analytics, so:
(everything is both on public sharing and static embed)
- pdf downloads on dashboards 
- png results on questions
- "download results" both on dashcards and questions

title: Fix querying `TIMESTAMP WITH LOCAL TIME ZONE` for oracle
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42325

The solution is actually in QP driver code, not sync. The clue is in [this comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42325#issuecomment-2164909535), which shows the values don't get converted by the driver code correctly as they come out of the database.

Previously, for a query that selects a `TIMESTAMP WITH LOCAL TIME ZONE` value from an Oracle DB, the value would have type `oracle.sql.TIMESTAMPLTZ` in the results of the query processor. Now it has a type of `java.sql.OffsetDateTime`, as it would with postgres and mysql.

Fingerprinting uses the query processor to select values from the table. The `:type/DateTime` fingerprinter expects that `:type/DateTime` values correspond to a `java.time.temporal/Temporal` object ([code](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/2e302014b64c253cd58645f30aaaf64e04f72b2c/src/metabase/analyze/fingerprint/fingerprinters.clj#L201)).
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Add Temporal Units List to Dashboard Parameters Schema
body:
Closes: #44361

This adds an entry to the Dashboard Parameter schema so that we can validate the list of temporal_units that might be passed from the frontend when adding or updating the `Unit of Time` type parameters.

title: [tiny PR:] fix(cache): Add missing question mark in the 'Clear cache' confirmation modal
body:
In Admin/Performance, when you click **Clear cache**, you see a confirmation modal, which displays the following message:

```
`Clear all cached results for ${targetName}`?
```

The question mark was missing. This PR adds it.

title: docs - generate config file
body:
This PR adds a new command that generates a config file template. The template is embedded in a Markdown file for documentation.

You can generate the config file template by changing into the top-level Metabase directory and running:

```
clojure -M:doc:ee config-template
```

The bulk of the code is dedicated to a) grabbing all of the `defsettings` available to configure in the config file and b) including the settings' default values. The code then includes some sample database and user settings as examples (supplied by a hand-written yaml file).

This PR reuses some code used to generate the environment variable docs.

## Feedback requested

- Are all the relevant settings included in the config template?
- Any settings we should exclude?
- Anything else we should test?

## Potential next steps

It would be nice to be able to configure settings in the UI then export a config file with the settings and their current values, maybe with an option to export only those settings that have been changed (i.e., where the values differ from the default values). We could reuse some of the code here, though we'd need to include database and user settings in that export.
author: jeff-bruemmer

title: Adjust distinct aggregation expansion on Mongo
body:
Closes  #35425

### Description

This PR modifies expressions that are used in `$addFields` stage in aggregation transformation. Specifically, names that are result of `:distinct` aggregation are wrapped in `$size` to produce actual counts.

### How to verify

- Existing test was modified to check for the new behavior.
- New test was added to check compilation of more complex case.
- New test was added to ensure querying works as expected even more complex case.

### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('Database/Mongo', None), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: fix(sdk): load custom font files when font is set to custom
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44370

### Description

Return custom font files when the embedded font is set to Custom.

### How to verify

- Go to the `fix-font-families` branch in the demo app. Run the demo app (including the API) locally.
- Fonts should now be loaded properly.

### Limitations

- We only support the 400, 700 and 900 weights in the appearance settings, and we can only set one font at a time. We will address this in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44394 next.

![CleanShot 2567-06-20 at 01 06 42@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/f3cb028d-bdb4-4ace-9184-40ec43f5130b)

title: Fix updating table questions in the notebook editor before running a query
body:
Closes #44415 

> [!NOTE]
> The PR label says "no-backport", but I already opened a manual backport here: #44424
> This PR is adding a repro test to a file that doesn't exist on the `release-x.50.x` branch, so I went ahead with a manual backport

After refactoring the viz settings and query results sync function to work with series objects in #44053, we ended up with an incomplete null check for `series.data`, as `data` in the `DatasetData` type isn't optional or nullable. Usually, the series doesn't have `data` when there's an error, but we're explicitly checking for errors. `syncTableColumnSettings` ([here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/863bc82af10e2c439dbd6e34f174078981e6ddb0/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/lib/sync-settings.ts#L116)) started failing if a table question with `table.columns` setting was opened directly in the notebook editor without running a query prior to that. We're calling `syncVizSettingsWithSeries` inside `updateQuestion`, so as a result it was rejecting any query changes

### To verify

1. New > question > orders > visualize
2. Resize/rearrange columns
3. Save, and open a link like `/question/:id/notebook`
4. Try to update the query (add/update/remove any clause)
5. Ensure it works
author: kulyk
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: remove code from useDashboardUrlParams and related files
body:
This PR removes a lot of `useState`s that were not needed as the values were set only once in a useEffect, it also removes the setXXX functions from being passed down to components that never used them.

It removes entirely the `useEmbedDisplayOptions` that was used only once in `useDashboardUrlParams` and instead uses `useEmbedFrameOptions` to get values from the hash parameters.


This may be easier to read if read commit by commit, but be aware that in some commits i'm moving some code that will be removed in following commits when I'll just use `useEmbedDisplayOptions`

title: Adjust undo toast timeout 12s -> 8s
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44423

### Description

Auto-wiring toast timeout is 12s, for undo toast we decided to reduce it to 8s.

### How to verify

- Add a dashboard with 2 cards and a filter
- map one card to a filter
- when "auto-connect" toast appears, click "auto-connect"
- make sure that undo toast is shown for 8s before disappearing

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/885cdada-c0f1-41e6-baa9-3ab92257672c

title: User parameter value json fix
body:
The `json-in` and `json-out` functions used for toucan model transforms do not perform any string escaping logic. This
makes sense as we don't want to make assumptions about the shape of data flowing in/out of the db. But, this did mean
that for the User paramter values table, string values were causing an error to be logged. This doesn't break
anything, as the function will still correctly return the string, but it can clutter up logs.

So, this PR creates a json-out version that doesn't log this error, to keep unneeded errors from cluttering the logs
author: adam-james-v
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: fix(cache): Add more e2e tests to Admin / Performance
body:
Adds e2e tests

Initially I thought it would be too difficult to test whether cache invalidation can be successfully configured, so that the cache really is deleted at the right times. Previous attempts to write caching-related e2e tests had not worked out a couple years ago. So I did not add e2e tests for the performance-related features. I forgot that another aspect of this feature also requires e2e tests: the basic behavior of the cache invalidation form, its ability to save input and display the result of the save. This PR adds those missing tests.

Closes #44478
author: rafpaf

title: Fix crash on restoring bookmarked items, update bookmarks on restore
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44224

### Description
Changes updates to bookmark store when Questions / Dashboards / Collections are updated, as well as re-fetches bookmarks when trashed items are restored.

_There is a separate PR fixing this in the release branch, since archive is a different experience in v50_

### How to verify

1. Have a bookmarked Question, Dashboard, and Collection. Move them to the trash
2. Without refreshing, Go to the trash and restore each of them. The application should not crash, and the item should appear in your bookmarks list
3. Repeat the process, but instead of restoring from the trash, restore from the entity page

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

body:
Issue https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44231
Comment https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44231#issuecomment-2178682975

Use a models for both PK + FK columns. This breaks the BE:
1. The BE no longer hydrates `param_fields` and `param_values` as it fails to find the corresponding DB field
2. The BE fails to find the find when doing a call for parameter values
