title: Add role to spec even if used in `:connection-uri`
body:
Closes #44351

This PR adds `:role` back to connection spec (to be used as connection property) even if `:connection-uri` that contains role parameter is used. `do-with-connection-options` code path seems not to use `:connection-uri`. That is used when queries are execute eg. via `jdbc/query` as in `driver/can-connect? :snowflake`.

Backend E2E tests were added to verify that:
- Default role is usable for creation of database and querying.
- Custom role is usable for creation of database and querying.
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('Database/Snowflake', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: ci(sdk): clarify SDK release workflow input description
body:
This workflow was copied over from `uberjar.yml` workflow, and the description was tweaked for flexibility. However, at some point, we decided the best way to deploy is to use the exact commit to avoid any accidental release. If you use a branch name like `master` we could accidentally release a different commit since there's no guarantee that at the time you start the workflow, the `master` branch would stay on the same commit you've acknowlegdged before.

See this [Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1718365926367029?thread_ts=1718356472.143249&cid=C063Q3F1HPF) for more details.
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

This PR resolves the following:

title: ci: Automatically add milestones to prs and issues
body:
> [!important]
> This workflow (but not the underlying js code) needs to be backported to all release branches we care about releasing

part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44037

### Description

![Screen Shot 2024-06-18 at 3 48 25 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/019abe22-470c-4831-9c0a-58b34b2cc5e6)

- Devs should no longer set milestones on issues manually EXCEPT to mark something as a release-blocker
- When any PR merges into a release branch, automatically set the next milestone on the linked issue or the PR itself.
- If the issue or PR already has a milestone, add an issue comment with the secondary milestone.

[Test Run](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9566147490/job/26370692501)


> [!note]
> *While this workflow handles the case of issues __omitted__ from a milestone, we also need to handle the case of things being added to milestones that didn't get merged to the release branch. This will be handled in a separate pre-release check.*
author: iethree
labels: [('.Building & Releasing', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

title: Fix timeline events filtering in the query builder
body:
Fixes #23336 

When viewing timeline events in QB chill mode, we're filtering out events outside the x-axis range. For instance, if we're viewing some data between 2022 and 2023, we don't want to see events from 2021 and 2024. The PR fixes a bug in this logic that was filtering out events in the last interval. For example, when viewing data between 2022 and 2023, the `xDomain` is `[ "01-01-2022", "01-01-2023" ]. We used to keep events in between these dates, but since we're using the first date of an interval, we're losing all the events past Jan 1, 2023, i.e., all of 2023. That happened for each absolute unit of time in the QB

### To verify

1. New > Question > Orders > Count by "Created At: Month" > Visualize
2. Click the calendar icon at the bottom right to open the events sidebar
3. The last month record is April 2026, so add an event on e.g. 10 April 2026, and ensure it's visible in the sidebar
4. Add an event past April 2026 and ensure it doesn't get displayed
5. Repeat similar steps for weeks, years, etc.
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Allow setting labels for filters
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44289

[Testing plan lives here](https://www.notion.so/metabase/test-plan-Add-custom-list-input-support-and-labels-for-parameters-111e1ea897914b7587a35bfaa5c8b24f)

### Description

Allow setting custom labels for dashboard parameters.

### To test

1. Create a dashboard with a visualization for the Accounts table
2. Create a text parameter and link it to Accounts -> First Name
3. Edit the parameter, set "How should people filter on this column?" to "Search box" and click "Edit"
4. In the modal select "Custom list" and enter
  ```
  Gaston, Leo
  Ben, Benjamin
  Kasey
  ```
5. Click Done and save the dashboard
6. Select the parameter and in the dropdown input enter "Leo", the corresponding option should show up, select it. The value tag should show "Leo"
7. Click "Update filter"
9. The paramter widget should show "Leo"
10. The dashboard should be filtered for "Gaston" values


Do the same when setting "How should people filter on this column?" to  "Dropdown list" and make sure Leo shows up

## Demo
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/dcf5b34d-2de2-4d67-84ce-235e248f2cff
author: romeovs
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Don't analyse non-SQL cards with Macaw
body:
Refs https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43516

### Description

Currently Macaw will try and fail on all non-SQL native cards, e.g. MongoDB. This saves all that blood, sweat, and tears.

The long term solution is to flip this around and call a multi-method which does the analysis, but we're holding back on a new driver method until we've rejigged things to be EE-only and figured out some naming.
author: crisptrutski

title: Disable SQL analysis by default + turn off all QueryField backfills
body: SQL analysis is not yes as robust as we would like, and does not yet power any customer facing features in v50. Some customers are seeing [huge amounts of related warnings](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44006), which also come at the cost of lots of exception catching, so we should disable it by default. There is still an option to opt-into it.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Upgrade RTK to v2
body:
Closes #44301

### Description

Upgrades `@reduxjs/toolkit` to v2 &`react-redux` to v9 (latest versions).
Removes unused `@types/redux-logger`.

Most important breaking changes (see [migration guide](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/usage/migrating-rtk-2)):
- ([docs](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/usage/migrating-rtk-2#createselector-uses-weakmapmemoize-as-default-memoizer)) `weakMapMemoize` is now the default memoization strategy in `createSelector`
- ([docs](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/usage/migrating-rtk-2#rtk-query-behaviour-changes)) RTK Query behavior changes
  - hopefully this will help us with some issues encountered during #43630
- ([docs](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/usage/migrating-rtk-2#action-types-must-be-strings)) action types must be strings
  - some of our older dependencies (react-router) still allow `type: any` in redux actions which will now clash with new action type definition
  - you can see an example of that in `auth/actions.ts` in this PR

### TODO

- I will re-run the unit-tests at least a few times before merging these, there are some flakes now related to the loading state
- I will follow up with a PR to deprecate & disallow imports from `redux-actions` package which is no longer maintained.

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Auto request review workflow
body:
Add a workflow that will request review based on file changes.
This works independently with CODEOWNERS.

I added myself and Cal to be added as reviewers for the migrations file as an example.

Note: we can also request team (e.g: core-backend-components) but it needs some more configuration, I'll make it work once we decide this is something we want.

---
But how is it different from CODEOWNERS?
With codeowners, it requests reviewers for the most specific pattern. An example:
- if Cam is the codeowner of `src/**`
- Ngoc is the codeowner of `src/metabase/pulse/**`

Then if there are changes to `src/metabase/pulse/core.clj` then only Ngoc is added as reviewer. Cam is excluded. But in some cases, we want both Ngoc and Cam to be added.

Read more [here](https://github.com/necojackarc/auto-request-review/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#motivation)

title: Pivot Tables with no Pivot Columns should still download
body:
Fixes #44159

Pivot Tables can still be valid without columns, and therefore the download should respect such a query and be successfully exported.

In this PR, the postprocessing of pivot results into 'visual pivot' exports for csv takes into account the zero-column configuration and the download no longer fails.

title: [Bug Fix] Use effective location when building initial path in entity picker
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44316

### Description
If the collection (or dashboard) picker is supplied with an initial value, it will try and compute a path to show panels in the entity picker. This was being computed from the `location` property, which can include collections the current user doesn't have access to. Switching this to use `effective_location` solves the issue above

### How to verify
1. log in as a user who has access to a sub collection, but doesn't have access to it's parent
2. create a question and save it in that sub collection
3. open the question that was just made, and try to move it. Everything should work as expected, and you should not see any panels that complain about permissions

### Demo
![chrome_NyR0PWKLCU](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/64294c26-99de-400a-851c-67010ac19fb4)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Reset temporal unit parameter value if it becomes no longer valid after temporal unit list changes
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42118
Demo https://www.loom.com/share/c736e1ffa6a14565b990b9ed295457c5

How to verify:
- Add a question with a breakout based on a date column to a dashboard
- Add a temporal unit parameter and map it to the breakout column
- Set the parameter value e.g. to "Year"
- Modify the list of allowed temporal units for this parameter to exclude "Year"
- The value of the parameter should be reset
- As a side note, the parameter value will be reset when toggling All/None in the temporal unit picker

title: Don't sort official collections first in trash
body:
Add a new query parameter to `/api/collection/:id/items` and `/api/collection/root/items`. If `official_collections_first` is passed, we'll sort official collections first, or not, as requested. If it isn't passed, we'll default to `false` for the trash collection, or `true` for normal collections.

Fixes #44373

title: Update the `Past` to `Previous` in date filters
body:
Closes #44340

### Description

This PR updates the copy in date filter pickers by replacing the word "Past" with the "Previous". It then proceeds to update and fix the related tests.

### How to verify

**Relative date picker**
1. Open Orders table
2. Click on the "Created At" header cell > Filter on this Column > Relative dates
3. It should say "Previous" instead of "Past"
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/1b0c3b58-c6c1-41c8-b4da-6f33d6abb953)
4. Add the filter and the filter pill should say "Created At is in the previous 30 days"
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/1c582525-6b1b-4aaa-8bb1-5e14a5c4a070)

This same component is used in the Notebook filter picker and in the chill mode filter modal.

**Timeseries chrome**
1. Orders > "Count" broken down by "Created at"
2. Visualize
3. Click on "All options" in the timeseries chrome
4. The list should contain "Previous" instead of "Past"
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/4d7a4db6-89ff-47a2-b240-81f1ca36e2e3)

**Dashboard relative filters**
1. Add Orders to the dashboard
2. Add a dashboard filter
3. Choose Time > Relative filter (optionally connect it to the dashboard card)
4. Save the dashboard
5. Click on the filter and you should see "Previous 7 days" and "Previous 30 days"
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/f18cd8b1-8e71-4c8a-95af-3e61aeb56e2a)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix(sdk): font size, color and padding in viz
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44222 and https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44226

### Description

Fixes the font sizes, colors and padding in visualizations for the embedding environment:

- Remove the hard-coded `isEmbeddingSdk` check and make chart padding customizable
   - Set card padding default to "0.5rem 1rem", the same as in Metabase app. The SDK default is applied before the `isQueryBuilder` check so the SDK padding is applied to Interactive Questions as well.
- Replace `px` and `rem` with `em` to enable font size scaling, i.e. configuring `theme.fontSize` to take effect. This is measured to not cause any noticeable changes in the main Metabase app.
   - Affected elements: pivot table cell, funnel typography, gauge label, chart legend item title.
   - How to test: set the font size to "0px" in the demo app. It should disappear if it's affected by font size scaling.
   - I have double-checked both dashboards and questions in the main Metabase app to ensure that the use of `em` here doesn't cause any cascading issues. When they do, we use the `units(...)` mechanism instead to retain `px` in the Metabase app.
- Change funnel text color to `text-dark` so it is themeable.

### Known exceptions to font size scaling

Changing `theme.fontSize` won't affect any of these elements:

- Data point values in cartesian charts (aka the value shown above bar / lines)
  - Trivial, but will cause this PR to be too big. Let's do it later.
- Previous value comparison text in smart scalar
  - Causes issue with text measurements, in which the breakpoint where the previous value comparison is visible changes quite a bit. Might be good to add an option later to hide the previous value comparison. I'll leave this out of the PR for now üòû 

### Caveat

- The trade-off to using `em` as opposed to `rem` is that it is affected by parent's font sizes, which cascades down the child. This is why I try to retain `px` for the main Metabase app for cases where it's not reliable to use `em`.
  - I've tested the changes in the Question Editor and Dashboard Editor, trying to identify potential cascade issues. Where else should I be testing in?

### How to verify

- Ensure that in the main Metabase app, there are no noticeable font size changes. This is already partially ensured by the use of Loki visual tests.
- Go to the `test-remaining-viz` branch in the demo app.
- Navigate to `/dev` to go to the Kitchen Sink.
- Change `theme.fontSize` in `AppProvider` to your desired values, e.g. `0px`, `14px`, `16px`, `18px`.
- The typography of all chart elements should change accordingly.

### Demo

Metabase app remains as-is, nothing changes

![CleanShot 2567-06-17 at 21 30 00@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/2c504405-a581-440d-907b-867e1fe3fad3)

Setting `theme.fontSize` to `0px` should remove all text in the viz test

![CleanShot 2567-06-17 at 21 31 06@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/b0a7c780-5d95-424b-9ece-4febe1783b72)

Setting `theme.fontSize` to `16px` should make everything bigger

![CleanShot 2567-06-17 at 21 46 31@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/715b488c-416f-45a5-a4b9-770a3d3ce643)

Setting `theme.components.cartesian.padding` to `2px 4px` to reduce the padding around charts

![CleanShot 2567-06-17 at 22 17 08@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/8360f5dd-4587-4c92-afcf-56ee6d7b7afc)

Setting `theme.components.cartesian.padding` to `0.5rem 1rem`, which is the new default. You can also remove the `padding` theme option from `AppProvider` to get this.

![CleanShot 2567-06-17 at 22 16 57@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/5d2e9bd8-3f13-4ca9-a4c5-befc7fbc49d9)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - visual test

title: Ensure the "Updated N minutes ago" message in the question footer is accurate
body:
**Note: probably certain BE changes should be made before this is merged**

![image.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/utGnP2ljFMMNOgi82vVn/9656a2a5-18cc-4d68-9a05-549192cc6a73.png)

On master, this message in the footer of a question is either hidden or says "Updated a few seconds ago". This PR fixes it so it will say "Updated N minutes ago" if the cache is N minutes old.

Probably the BE that sets the `updated_at` field of a card needs to be updated before this is merged.

Closes #42778

title: Update look and feel copy
body:
Part of #44273

I initially intended for this PR to implement the toggle for #44273, but after the initial copy change, it seemed it involved a lot of line changes, so I'll just leave it here.

This PR updates the copy on the "Look and Feel" tab (was "Appearance") and reorders the location of each setting + renames some labels to [match the design](https://www.figma.com/design/1YcsFf5yYdFZTguwoKVdkj/Re-design-the-transparent-background-setting-in-interactive-embedds?node-id=917-6518&t=NKXLRBgBaxzBbFQe-0). 

No new tests has been added, since this is only changing copies, only failed existing tests are fixed.

title: fix: Remove references in the FE to the deprecated `enable-query-caching` setting
body:
This setting is deprecated. Unfortunately, it is set to false by default, there is no way to set it to true through the UI. On master, if it is false, certain features are switched off in the FE. This PR fixes that.

Closes #44250

title: Highlight Trash collection in sidebar when viewing root trash collection or a trashed item

title: Fix remapped values in public dashboards
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44231

2 issues:
- mixed remapped & non-remapped values were not handled in the parameter values call (exception - malli schema error)
- foreign key `target` field was not hydrated in public dashboards; this case worked in the app only because `target` was hydrated in `query_metadata`

BE changes implemented by @qnkhuat

title: Change run to make-run in process-query-for-card
body:
Fixes #44160

There were two levers where a card could change how it was run.

`qp` this is basically `qp/process-query` with some optional userland flags and constraints marked on the passed in query. In the case of pivot tables in the
`/pivot/:card-id/query` endpoints it was `qp.pivot/process-query`

'run' this defaults to a streaming response that takes the `qp` param and `export-format` and passes a query to qp. Most often this is overriden to not stream the response.

Unfortunately, if `run` is overwritten, then `qp` is thrown away, and the caller who overrides `run` must determine the correct `qp` to use.

However, when running `process-query-for-dashcard` it is difficult to properly set `qp` for all of the dashcards without doing card lookups. So [this commit](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/release-x.50.x/src/metabase/query_processor/card.clj#L230-L232) did a check to swap the runner in the presence of a pivot query that calls the **default** runner with a `qp.pivot/run-pivot-query`. The problem is that pulse needs to use a non-default runner, but there's no way for `process-query-for-card` to do both.

This commit changes `run` to `make-run` which raises the abstraction to a function that produces a runer given a `qp`. This allows `process-query-for-card` to change the `qp` as needed while keeping the passed in runner.

There's really three things going on that could be teased apart further/better.

1. `qp` - this conflates the processor (`qp/process-query` `qp.pivot/run-pivot-query`) and modifying query (`qp/userland-query`, `qp/userland-query-with-default-constraints` `(update query :info merge info)`)
2. `make-run` - How the above are processed: (streaming/realized)
author: snoe
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: SCIM feature branch
body:
This PR contains the implementation of the core SCIM endpoints, as well as some updates to the infra which was merged earlier.

The core pieces in this PR are:
* Malli schemas for SCIM users and gruops
* `GET /Users`
* `GET /Users/:id`
* `POST /Users`
* `GET /Groups`
* A couple new settings and a `GET /api_key` endpoint (and removed a `DELETE` endpoint)

These are the core pieces which are required for integration with Okta, according to Okta's own test suite. Here's a recent test run: https://www.runscope.com/radar/ce1d7r90093i/d858ffb6-0dfa-499f-bf51-db94330a6772/history/87e1efe0-7be2-4e82-b195-65679492acca

Pieces which will be in a separate PR:
* A `PUT` endpoint for deactivating/reactivating users
* Group membership management
* A couple remaining open product questions

Pursuant to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38621
author: noahmoss
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Elevate "starting from" option in the relative date picker
body:
### Description

This micro-pr elevates the "Starting from" icon/action in the relative date picker, as per design in Figma. It is a part of the Milestone 1 of #44096

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

**Notebook**
1. Open Orders table in a notebook view
2. Click on a filter > Created At
3. Choose "Relative dates"
4. Popover should show an "arrow left" icon, in the same row as the number input and the time period input
5. Hovering the icon should show a tooltip "Starting from..."
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/52d6b9c0-2407-455e-b838-3731f26cc201)
6. Clicking the icon should make it possible to set the date offset in the row below ("include this" should NOT be visible)
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/0094a0ca-fa77-47e1-907f-fc9a95ee6f4e)
7. Clicking on "X" next to the offset should remove this row, and the arrow left icon should be visible again.
8. Include this should be visible again, but reset to unchecked

**Filter modal**
1. Open Orders table
2. Click on a "Filter" (pill)
3. Choose `...` next to "Created At" and choose "Relative dates"
4. Popover should show a toggle with "Include this..." period
5. Hovering the icon should show a tooltip "Starting from..."
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/b6a674af-6764-4496-8f19-8cb86a1c65f6)
6. Clicking the icon should make it possible to set the date offset in the row below ("include this" should NOT be visible)
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/dc08a2fc-df36-4804-9924-559e3123917d)
7. Clicking on "X" next to the offset should remove this row, and the arrow left icon should be visible again.
8. Include this should be visible again, but reset to unchecked

**Drill-through context**
1. Open Orders table
2. Click on a table header cell "Created At"
3. Filter by this column
4. Relative dates
5. Hovering the icon should show a tooltip "Starting from..."
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/2605205b-6a5d-4232-8f58-2ac97cb18923)
6. Clicking the icon should make it possible to set the date offset in the row below ("include this" should NOT be visible)
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/69218925-13ab-4868-94d1-3a4c284da98c)
7. Clicking on "X" next to the offset should remove this row, and the arrow left icon should be visible again.
8. Include this should be visible again, but reset to unchecked

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Fix collection id on collection items endpoint
body:
When fetching collection items, we need to fetch the true
`collection_id` in order to figure out things like `can_restore` and
`can_delete`, but set it to the displayed/effective `collection_id` when
we actually send it out.

This fixes a bug where collections had their `collection_id` match their
`id` when returned by this endpoint.

Also, fix a potential bug in `hydrate-can-restore`: if the `items` you're hydrating already have a `:collection` key it would be overwritten. AFAICT this wasn't actually being hit, but seems best to fix it anyway.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Fix metabase lib returning the string "null" as the drill through value
body:
Fixes #44232

### Description

This PR is reusing the technique that already existed, in which we'd check if the `:value` is a keyword `:null` and return `nil` instead. That logic is now encapsulated in a new `drill-value->js` function.

So after we fixed the `:null` - > `"null", we're left with one more transformation.

In Clojure, `nil` is `sequable`, so it was hitting [this condition](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/fdc0b71512835263b6cb52e22b7bf03cb1a3bb0f/src/metabase/lib/js.cljs#L376). So we ended up converting an empty list `()` into an empty array `[]` [because of this line](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/fdc0b71512835263b6cb52e22b7bf03cb1a3bb0f/src/metabase/lib/js.cljs#L361).

Credits and kudos to @piranha for helping me debug this, and for fixing the latter issue.

### How to verify

Follow the repro steps from the original issue and confirm that the value is now a proper JS `null`.


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Custom labels for number parameter
body:
[Testing plan](https://www.notion.so/metabase/test-plan-Add-custom-list-input-support-and-labels-for-parameters-111e1ea897914b7587a35bfaa5c8b24f)

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44054

### Description

Adds the ability to add custom labels to number parameters.

## Testing this PR
1. Create a dashboard with a visualization for the Accounts table
2. Create a number parameter and link it to Accounts -> Seats
3. Edit the parameter, set "How should people filter on this column?" to "Search box" and click "Edit"
4. In the modal select "Custom list" and enter
  ```
  10, Ten
  21, Twenty-one
  42
  ```
5. Click Done and save the dashboard
6. Select the parameter and in the dropdown input enter "Ten", the corresponding option should show up, select it. The value tag should show "Ten"
7. Click "Update filter"
9. The parameter widget should show "Ten"

The dashboard should be filtered with only rows with 10 seats showing up
Do the same when setting "How should people filter on this column?" to  "Dropdown list" and make sure "Ten" shows up.

Try the same for native queries with a number variable.
author: romeovs
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Flag to hide download buttons
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44067

This PR adds a `downloadsEnabled` prop that's passed down from the public/static dashboards/cards to the components that needs it.

For now it's always set to true in both the oss plugin and the ee one, but on the next PR I'll change the EE plugin code to deal with the hash parameters (the old one + the new `downloads` one).

I'll also add the tests on the next PR so that it can write them using the hash parameters directly to make them more accurate

title: Better Release Slack Notifications
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44154

### Description

Adds additional automated slack messages to the release process, and updates an existing message
- Build start message now tags the person who triggered the build
- Adds a message to notify of the result of pre-release testing
- Adds a message to notify that the publish job has started
- Automates (the previously manual) step of notifying that the publish is complete.
- Automates (the previously manual) step of notifying the #general channel that the release is complete

![Screen Shot 2024-06-14 at 10 59 45 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/9c14c8e7-da98-4146-959f-55f657dee3b7)


‚úÖ Test run:
- [tag workflow](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9513241398)
- [test workflow](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9513263640)
- [publish workflow](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9513357424)
- [slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C01BWAZJE0N/p1718354425203489)

title: fix charts crash in safari when dataset timezone is not in iana format
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44128 ### Description The new implementation of cartesian charts use `dayjs` instead of `moment` since it has been deprecated. Dayjs relies on browser APIs but it can behave differently depending on a browser engine. Turns out Safari does not support non-IANA time zones, that are offsets, such as `+00:00` as they come from the backend side. Since there are cases when an arbitrary offset does not have a non-DST IANA timezone, I went with the approach of adding or subtracting the offset value in minutes. ### How to verify - Revert all changes except for the new `safari-non-iana-timezone-repro-44128` story - Run storybook - Open the story in Safari (I could repro on 17.1.2) - Ensure it fails - Return back all the changes - Ensure the story works in Safari ### Demo Works in Safari: ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix mutating frozen settings when display changes
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44121

### Description

The original issue appears to be involving a question with a certain combination of viz settings that cause the error. I could not reproduce it locally but the logs are clearly pointing out to the inability to assign `'stackable.stack_display'` to a frozen object in `onDisplayUpdate` function which is invoked when question display type changes.

This code does not exist in v50 anymore so this PR targets v49 branch.

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'stackable.stack_display' of object '#<Object>'
    at lK.onDisplayUpdate (BarChart.jsx:50:42)
    at ChartTypeSidebar.tsx:105:49
```

### How to verify

Ensure unit tests are passing

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Elevate include this period in the relative date picker
body: ### Description This PR elevates "Include this..." option in the UI for: - Notebook filters - Filter modal (simple mode) - Drill-through filters They are all using the same component, so fixing it in one place updated all of the above. This resolves the majority of the tasks in the Milestone 1 of #44096 ### How to verify Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected. **Notebook** 1. Open Orders table in a notebook view 2. Click on a filter > Created At 3. Choose "Relative dates" 4. Popover should show a toggle with "Include this..." period **Filter modal** 1. Open Orders table 2. Click on a "Filter" (pill) 3. Choose `...` next to "Created At" and choose "Relative dates" 4. Popover should show a toggle with "Include this..." period **Drill-through context** 1. Open Orders table 2. Click on a table header cell "Created At" 3. Filter by this column 4. Relative dates 5. Popover should show a toggle with "Include this..." period > [!Note] > For all of the options above, this should work the same for both `Past` and `Next` ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR ### Out of scope - Updating the design any further (will be a theme in a separate PR)
